title: Google\Cloud\SecurityCenter\V1\Source
name: Source
description:
Security Command Center finding source. A finding source is an entity or a mechanism that can produce a finding. A source is like a container of findings that come from the same scanner, logger, monitor, and other tools.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.securitycenter.v1.Source

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: The relative resource name of this source. See: https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/resource_names#relative_resource_name Example: "organizations/{organization_id}/sources/{source_id}"

params.name: data.display_name
params.description: The source's display name. A source's display name must be unique amongst its siblings, for example, two sources with the same parent can't share the same display name. The display name must have a length between 1 and 64 characters (inclusive).

params.name: data.description
params.description: The description of the source (max of 1024 characters). Example: "Web Security Scanner is a web security scanner for common vulnerabilities in App Engine applications. It can automatically scan and detect four common vulnerabilities, including cross-site-scripting (XSS), Flash injection, mixed content (HTTP in HTTPS), and outdated or insecure libraries."

params.name: data.canonical_name
params.description: The canonical name of the finding. It's either "organizations/{organization_id}/sources/{source_id}", "folders/{folder_id}/sources/{source_id}" or "projects/{project_number}/sources/{source_id}", depending on the closest CRM ancestor of the resource associated with the finding.
